snippet: This year, when Donald Keene, 90, a New York native and retired professor, became a citizen of Japan, he gained what eludes many Westerners who live there: acceptance.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Donald Keene, New York native and retired Columbia professor who became Japanese citizen; Keene has managed to gain acceptance that eludes many Westerners who live there.
lead_paragraph: This year, when Donald Keene, 90, a New York native and retired professor, became a citizen of Japan, he gained what eludes many Westerners who live there: acceptance.

headline.seo: With Citizenship, Japan Embraces Columbia Scholar
headline.main: Lifelong Scholar of the Japanese Becomes One of Them
headline.print_headline: Lifelong Scholar of the Japanese Becomes One of Them
